title: Website champion descriptions are not working...

body:
The "official" descriptions on the Riot League of Legends website are not working properly... can you fix that please?  Otherwise, I have to go to third-party websites to see my champion stats, which is very annoying (and not necessarily trustworthy - I prefer to get the important data directly from Riot).

Here is an example of the description of Katarina's R as it shows in my browser (Chrome) - I highlighted the relevant passages in bold, they don't show bold in the browser:

#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Death Lotus
Cost: No Cost
Range: 550

Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, dealing massive magic damage while she channels to the 3 nearest enemy champions.

Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, rapidly throwing knives at the three nearest enemy champions, **dealing {{ damagecalc }} magic damage** per knife.
Total **over {{ duration }} seconds** to each enemy: **{{ totaldamagecalc }} magic damage**.Applies Grievous Wounds to all enemies struck, reducing their healing and regeneration by 40%.
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Thank you!

replies.body: Yup, noticed that as well... since quite a time, would be great to have one source of actually correct game data :))
P.S. Same on Safari and on Firefox browsers
I literally never use the official site for that, as the wiki is both more detailed and more reliable (although it's slow as hell with all the ads).

>
> I literally never use the official site for that, as the wiki is both more detailed and more reliable (although it's slow as hell with all the ads).

I understand (and do the same) - but still, let's be honest: we have one of the most successful competitive games out there, and there is NO official (neither on the website, nor in-game, mind you) way to see the stats of the champions? I'd say it's critical... how to competitive teams do it? How do you know what you should ACTUALLY build, instead of just blindly following what people on OP.GG say?

And it's not even that Riot says "we dont' want to show it" - very obviously, the website INTENTS to have this information, but because the front-end team isn't able to use JS correctly, ti just doesn't work.... comeeeeeoooooon, that just can't be true, this is a commercial product!! :) 

Right?

Right, but it's easier and cheaper to not care.

As a side note: that means there is currently NO official source of information about the damage per tick, ratios etc. - the game client does NOT show it... it only shows the end result AFTER items...
Also, I just checked on OP.gg, and they seem to have the same problem (if you check their Champion descriptions)... is that on purpose?!
It is the same thing in Germany - same issue with the website (https://euw.leagueoflegends.com/de/game-info/champions/Katarina/)
